Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for containerized workloads, including resource allocation, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Container Instances.
Design the container architecture, including the placement of containers, networking requirements, and integration with existing Azure services.
Create and configure Azure Container Instances in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure proper resource allocation and region selection.
Set up networking for the container instances, including virtual networks, subnets, and DNS configurations. Ensure secure communication between containers and other Azure services.
Enable required security measures, such as encryption for data in transit and at rest, and configure access control policies for container instances.
Deploy containerized applications to Azure Container Instances. Ensure proper configuration of environment variables, storage mounts, and container images.
Perform thorough testing of the container instances, including application functionality, scalability, and failover scenarios.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Container Insights. Configure alerts for container performance, resource usage, and availability.
Document the container architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting container instances.
Ensure the container setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
